joke_responses: Why did the coffee file a police report? It got mugged!
What do you call a fake noodle? An impasta!
Why don't some couples go to the gym? Because some relationships don't work out!
What do you call a bear in the rain? A drizzly bear!
Why don't scientists trust atoms? Because they make up everything!
What do you call a bear with no teeth? A gummy bear!
Why did the scarecrow win an award? He was outstanding in his field!
What do you call a sleeping bull? A bulldozer!
Why don't skeletons fight each other? They don't have the guts!
What's the best thing about Switzerland? I don't know, but the flag is a big plus!
Why don't eggs tell jokes? They'd crack each other up!
What do you call a dinosaur that crashes his car? Tyrannosaurus Wrecks!
fun_fact_responses: Did you know that the first computer bug was an actual bug? Grace Hopper found a moth stuck in a computer relay in 1947!
Fun fact: The term 'debugging' comes from Admiral Grace Hopper literally removing bugs from early computers!
Here's something cool: Raspberry Pi computers like the one I'm running on are more powerful than the computers that sent humans to the moon!
Interesting fact: The first webcam was created to monitor a coffee pot at Cambridge University so people could see if coffee was available!
Did you know that butterflies taste with their feet?
Fun fact: A group of pugs is called a 'grumble'!
Here's something lovely: Dolphins have names for each other!
Interesting fact: Cats have a special scent organ called the Jacobson's organ that helps them 'taste' smells!
Did you know that octopuses have three hearts and blue blood?
Fun fact: Honey never spoils! Archaeologists have found 3000-year-old honey that's still perfectly edible.
Here's something amazing: A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'!
Interesting fact: Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't!
Dude, did you know that sharks have been around longer than trees? That's wild!
Check this out: A shrimp's heart is in its head!
Fun fact bro: Wombat poop is cube-shaped! Nature is weird!
Here's something cool: Penguins can jump as high as 6 feet out of water!
